section.title: Set Up a Runtime Server Using Server Manager
section.para: Runtime servers can be set up from within the Java EE Web Project wizard. But for the purposes of exploring JBoss Developer Studio the procedure below sets up the runtime server first.

procedure.title: Set Up a New Runtime Server

step.para: Click the Servers tab. If the Servers tab is not visible, click Window→Show View→Servers.
To set up a new runtime server, click new server wizard. This opens the Define a New Server wizard.
From the Select the server type list, expand JBoss Enterprise Middleware and select JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.x.
Click Finish to close the Define a New Server wizard. The wizard create a new instance of a JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6 runtime server, which is visible in the Servers tab.

The runtime server is initially shown in stopped mode. To start the runtime server, right-click JBoss EAP 6.0 Runtime Server and click Start. After a short pause, the view switches to the Console tab and shows the startup output of the runtime server.
